title: Bug report on IndexError
body_html:
🐛 Bug

Hello pytorch developers, I think I have encountered a bug on tensor index

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. I'm trying to re-combine the rows in the tensor, so I did:
    a = torch.randn(m,n)
    b = array(list(combinations(range(m),2)))

  2. Then, a[b] shall return a rearranged tensor. As long as m >= 9, then everything is fine, however, when m is less than 9, then it returns an index error: Too many indices for a tensor of dimension 2.

##Sample code:
from numpy import array
import torch
from itertools import combinations

a = torch.randn(8,3)
b = array(list(combinations(range(8),2)))
a[b]

Expected behavior

a[b] should returns a 28 by 2 by 3 tensor, however, it returns an index error.

Environment

Please copy and paste the output from our
environment collection script
(or fill out the checklist below manually).

You can get the script and run it with:

wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py
# For security purposes, please check the contents of collect_env.py before running it.
python collect_env.py
  • PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 0.4.1
  • OS (e.g., Linux): Ubuntu 18.04
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):
  • Python version: 3.7
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: None
  • GPU models and configuration: None
  • Any other relevant information:

Additional context

body:
## 🐛 Bug
Hello pytorch developers, I think I have encountered a bug on tensor index

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. I'm trying to re-combine the rows in the tensor, so I did:
a = torch.randn(m,n)
b = array(list(combinations(range(m),2)))

2. Then, a[b] shall return a rearranged tensor. As long as m >= 9, then everything is fine, however, when m is less than 9, then it returns an index error: Too many indices for a tensor of dimension 2.

<!-- If you have a code sample, error messages, stack traces, please provide it here as well -->
##Sample code:
from numpy import array
import torch
from itertools import combinations

a =  torch.randn(8,3)
b = array(list(combinations(range(8),2)))
a[b]

## Expected behavior
a[b] should returns a 28 by 2 by 3 tensor, however, it returns an index error.
 
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

## Environment

Please copy and paste the output from our
[environment collection script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py)
(or fill out the checklist below manually).

You can get the script and run it with:
```
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py
# For security purposes, please check the contents of collect_env.py before running it.
python collect_env.py
```
